main event: Two round white objects were observed on radar by an aircraft crew, with one object appearing to have an orange tail and emitting orange sparks.
interesting points: The objects were observed at different elevations and headings, indicating they were moving independently.
The first object faded from view, while the second object disappeared beneath the aircraft.
The sightings were reported by two officers, Captain Donald G. Nessandank and Lieutenant Robert W. Greer, who were considered reliable observers.
The weather conditions at the time of the sightings were clear, with varying wind speeds and directions at different altitudes.
The report suggests the objects may have been meteors, but their characteristics and behavior indicated they were not easily explainable.
sighted object: Two round white objects, one with an orange tail and sparks
witnesses: Pilot and co-pilot of an RC-121 aircraft
